RandomMixer.hpp
Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /**
00002  * \file RandomMixer.hpp
00003  * \brief Header for Mixer classes.
00004  *
00005  * Mixer classes convert a seed vector into a random generator state.  An
00006  * important property of this method is that "close" seeds should produce
00007  * "widely separated" states.  This allows the seeds to be set is some
00008  * systematic fashion to produce a set of uncorrelated random number
00009  * sequences.
00010  *
00011  * Copyright (c) Charles Karney (2006-2011) <charles@karney.com> and licensed
00012  * under the MIT/X11 License.  For more information, see
00013  * http://randomlib.sourceforge.net/
00014  **********************************************************************/
00015 
00016 #if !defined(RANDOMLIB_RANDOMMIXER_HPP)
00017 #define RANDOMLIB_RANDOMMIXER_HPP \
00018   "$Id: 3d27a785e2b6dd75883a6daca62a885e01866c5d $"
00019 
00020 #include <vector>
00021 #include <string>
00022 #include <RandomLib/RandomSeed.hpp>
00023 
00024 namespace RandomLib {
00025 
00026   /**
00027    * \brief The original %MT19937 mixing functionality
00028    *
00029    * This implements the functionality of init_by_array in MT19937
00030    * http://www.math.sci.hiroshima-u.ac.jp/~m-mat/MT/MT2002/CODES/mt19937ar.c
00031    * and init_by_array64 in MT19937_64
00032    * http://www.math.sci.hiroshima-u.ac.jp/~m-mat/MT/VERSIONS/C-LANG/mt19937-64.c
00033    * with the following changes:
00034    * - in the case of an zero-length seed array, behave in the same way if
00035    *   MT19937 and MT19937_64 are called without initialization in which case,
00036    *   e.g., init_genrand(5489UL) is called.  (init_by_array does not allow
00037    *   calling with a zero-length seed.)
00038    * - init_by_array64 accepts a seed array of 64-bit unsigned ints.  Here with
00039    *   seed is an array of 32-bit unsigned ints and these are repacked into
00040    *   64-bit quantities internally using a LSB convention.  Thus, to mimic the
00041    *   MT19937_64 sample invocation with a seed array {0x12345ULL, 0x23456ULL,
00042    *   0x34567ULL, 0x45678ULL}, MixerMT0<Random_u64>::SeedToState needs to
00043    *   be invoked with a seed vector [0x12345UL, 0, 0x23456UL, 0, 0x34567UL, 0,
00044    *   0x45678UL, 0].  (Actually the last 0 is unnecessary.)
00045    *
00046    * The template parameter \e RandomType switches between the 32-bit and
00047    * 64-bit versions.
00048    *
00049    * MixerMT0 is specific to the MT19937 generators and should not be used
00050    * for other generators (e.g., SFMT19937).  In addition, MixerMT0 has
00051    * known defects and should only be used to check the operation of the
00052    * MT19937 engines against the original implementation.  These defects are
00053    * described in the MixerMT1 which is a modification of MixerMT0
00054    * which corrects these defects.  For production use MixerMT1 or,
00055    * preferably, MixerSFMT should be used.
00056    *
00057    * @tparam RandomType the type of the results, either Random_u32 or
00058    *   Random_u64.
00059    **********************************************************************/
00060   template<class RandomType> class RANDOM_EXPORT MixerMT0 {
00061   public:
00062     /**
00063      * The RandomType controlling the output of MixerMT0::SeedToState
00064      **********************************************************************/
00065     typedef RandomType mixer_t;
00066     /**
00067      * A version number which should be unique to this RandomMixer.  This
00068      * prevents RandomEngine::Load from loading a saved generator with a
00069      * different RandomMixer.  Here the version is "MxMT" or "MxMU".
00070      **********************************************************************/
00071     static const unsigned version = 0x4d784d54UL + (mixer_t::width == 64);
00072   private:
00073     /**
00074      * The unsigned type corresponding to mixer_t.
00075      **********************************************************************/
00076     typedef typename mixer_t::type mixer_type;
00077     /**
00078      * The mask for mixer_t.
00079      **********************************************************************/
00080     static const mixer_type mask = mixer_t::mask;
00081   public:
00082     /**
00083      * Mix the seed vector, \e seed, into the state array, \e state, of size \e
00084      * n.
00085      *
00086      * @param[in] seed the input seed vector.
00087      * @param[out] state the generator state.
00088      * @param[in] n the size of the state.
00089      **********************************************************************/
00090     static void SeedToState(const std::vector<RandomSeed::seed_type>& seed,
00091                             mixer_type state[], unsigned n) throw();
00092     /**
00093      * Return the name of this class.
00094      *
00095      * @return the name.
00096      **********************************************************************/
00097     static std::string Name() {
00098       return "MixerMT0<Random_u" +
00099         std::string(mixer_t::width == 32 ? "32" : "64") + ">";
00100     }
00101   private:
00102     static const mixer_type a0 = 5489ULL;
00103     static const mixer_type a1 = 19650218ULL;
00104     static const mixer_type
00105       b = mixer_t::width == 32 ? 1812433253ULL : 6364136223846793005ULL;
00106     static const mixer_type
00107       c = mixer_t::width == 32 ?    1664525ULL : 3935559000370003845ULL;
00108     static const mixer_type
00109       d = mixer_t::width == 32 ? 1566083941ULL : 2862933555777941757ULL;
00110   };
00111 
00112   /**
00113    * \brief The modified %MT19937 mixing functionality
00114    *
00115    * MixerMT0 has two defects
00116    * - The zeroth word of the state is set to a constant (independent of the
00117    *   seed).  This is a relatively minor defect which halves the accessible
00118    *   state space for MT19937 (but the resulting state space is still huge).
00119    *   (Actually, for the 64-bit version, it reduces the accessible states by
00120    *   2<sup>33</sup>.  On the other hand the 64-bit has better mixing
00121    *   properties.)
00122    * - Close seeds, for example, [1] and [1,0], result in the same state.  This
00123    *   is a potentially serious flaw which might result is identical random
00124    *   number sequences being generated instead of independent sequences.
00125    *
00126    * MixerMT1 fixes these defects in a straightforward manner.  The
00127    * resulting algorithm was included in one of the proposals for Random Number
00128    * Generation for C++0X, see Brown, et al.,
00129    * http://www.open-std.org/jtc1/sc22/wg21/docs/papers/2006/n2079.pdf
00130    *
00131    * The template parameter \e RandomType switches between the 32-bit and
00132    * 64-bit versions.
00133    *
00134    * MixerMT1 still has a weakness in that it doesn't thoroughly mix the
00135    * state.  This is illustrated by an example given to me by Makoto Matsumoto:
00136    * Consider a seed of length \e N and suppose we consider all \e
00137    * W<sup><i>N</i>/2</sup> values for the first half of the seed (here \e W =
00138    * 2<sup><i>width</i></sup>).  MixerMT1 has a bottleneck in the way that
00139    * the state is initialized which results in the second half of the state
00140    * only taking on \e W<sup>2</sup> possible values.  MixerSFMT mixes the
00141    * seed into the state much more thoroughly.
00142    *
00143    * @tparam RandomType the type of the results, either Random_u32 or
00144    *   Random_u64.
00145    **********************************************************************/
00146   template<class RandomType> class RANDOM_EXPORT MixerMT1 {
00147   public:
00148     /**
00149      * The RandomType controlling the output of MixerMT1::SeedToState
00150      **********************************************************************/
00151     typedef RandomType mixer_t;
00152     /**
00153      * A version number which should be unique to this RandomMixer.  This
00154      * prevents RandomEngine::Load from loading a saved generator with a
00155      * different RandomMixer.  Here the version is "MxMV" or "MxMW".
00156      **********************************************************************/
00157     static const unsigned version = 0x4d784d56UL + (mixer_t::width == 64);
00158   private:
00159     /**
00160      * The unsigned type corresponding to mixer_t.
00161      **********************************************************************/
00162     typedef typename mixer_t::type mixer_type;
00163     /**
00164      * The mask for mixer_t.
00165      **********************************************************************/
00166     static const mixer_type mask = mixer_t::mask;
00167   public:
00168     /**
00169      * Mix the seed vector, \e seed, into the state array, \e state, of size \e
00170      * n.
00171      *
00172      * @param[in] seed the input seed vector.
00173      * @param[out] state the generator state.
00174      * @param[in] n the size of the state.
00175      **********************************************************************/
00176     static void SeedToState(const std::vector<RandomSeed::seed_type>& seed,
00177                             mixer_type state[], unsigned n) throw();
00178     /**
00179      * Return the name of this class.
00180      *
00181      * @return the name.
00182      **********************************************************************/
00183     static std::string Name() {
00184       return "MixerMT1<Random_u" +
00185         std::string(mixer_t::width == 32 ? "32" : "64") + ">";
00186     }
00187   private:
00188     static const mixer_type a = 5489ULL;
00189     static const mixer_type
00190       b = mixer_t::width == 32 ? 1812433253ULL : 6364136223846793005ULL;
00191     static const mixer_type
00192       c = mixer_t::width == 32 ?    1664525ULL : 3935559000370003845ULL;
00193     static const mixer_type
00194       d = mixer_t::width == 32 ? 1566083941ULL : 2862933555777941757ULL;
00195   };
00196 
00197   /**
00198    * \brief The SFMT mixing functionality
00199    *
00200    * MixerSFMT is adapted from SFMT's init_by_array Mutsuo Saito given in
00201    * http://www.math.sci.hiroshima-u.ac.jp/~m-mat/MT/SFMT/SFMT-src-1.2.tar.gz
00202    * and is part of the C++0X proposal; see P. Becker, Working Draft, Standard
00203    * for Programming Language C++, Oct. 2007, Sec. 26.4.7.1,
00204    * http://www.open-std.org/jtc1/sc22/wg21/docs/papers/2007/n2461.pdf
00205    *
00206    * MixerSFMT contains a single change is to allow it to function properly
00207    * when the size of the state is small.
00208    *
00209    * MixerSFMT mixes the seed much more thoroughly than MixerMT1 and, in
00210    * particular, it removes the mixing bottleneck present in MixerMT1.
00211    * Thus it is the recommended mixing scheme for all production work.
00212    **********************************************************************/
00213   class RANDOM_EXPORT MixerSFMT {
00214   public:
00215     /**
00216      * The RandomType controlling the output of MixerSFMT::SeedToState
00217      **********************************************************************/
00218     typedef Random_u32 mixer_t;
00219     /**
00220      * A version number which should be unique to this RandomMixer.  This
00221      * prevents RandomEngine::Load from loading a saved generator with a
00222      * different RandomMixer.  Here the version is "MxSM".
00223      **********************************************************************/
00224     static const unsigned version = 0x4d78534dUL;
00225   private:
00226     /**
00227      * The unsigned type corresponding to mixer_t.
00228      **********************************************************************/
00229     typedef mixer_t::type mixer_type;
00230     /**
00231      * The mask for mixer_t.
00232      **********************************************************************/
00233     static const mixer_type mask = mixer_t::mask;
00234   public:
00235     /**
00236      * Mix the seed vector, \e seed, into the state array, \e state, of size \e
00237      * n.
00238      *
00239      * @param[in] seed the input seed vector.
00240      * @param[out] state the generator state.
00241      * @param[in] n the size of the state.
00242      **********************************************************************/
00243     static void SeedToState(const std::vector<RandomSeed::seed_type>& seed,
00244                             mixer_type state[], unsigned n) throw();
00245     /**
00246      * Return the name of this class.
00247      *
00248      * @return the name.
00249      **********************************************************************/
00250     static std::string Name() { return "MixerSFMT"; }
00251   private:
00252     static const mixer_type a = 0x8b8b8b8bUL;
00253     static const mixer_type b = 1664525UL;
00254     static const mixer_type c = 1566083941UL;
00255   };
00256 
00257 } // namespace RandomLib
